It's great for support too, you know.. to have two kinds of vision control.  You can sightstone + pink ward trinket upgrade, or sightstone + red trinket upgrade.  Which ever way you wish to go, upgrading the trinket is for everyone.

When behind, it gives you the security necessary to farm in safety. 250 gold won't give you enough combat stats to get a comeback. 750gold+ worth of wards will.

When ahead, it gives you the safety to farm your lane opponent or roam and gank. When you're ahead, you're not lacking combat stats. You can get some after spending 250 and still be ahead.

A lot of times I just plain forget to upgrade. I go to the store, buy my items and completely forget about upgrades. Lel.

Once you realize that you need those wards in order to properly play the game, you'll start to remember.  You need to look at the yellow trinket upgrade as a tool that will allow you to pressure the map and play aggressive WHILE ALSO PLAYING SAFE.  There is no way in hell you can properly split-push (or even just apply map pressure) without 3 of your own wards down.  You will get burned so hard by not knowing what the enemy is doing and reacting to their movements that it becomes something worth remembering.

I used to be like that until I started playing support regularly; you get used to being able to have vision on demand. The lack of ability to drop wards everywhere I need them in lane (especially mid) is a constant reminder that I need that upgrade.

What annoys me though is that upgrading resets the cooldown of the trinket so if I back without dropping one last trinket ward before upgrade, I end up handicapped while the new one accrues a charge.

I was skeptical at first, but upgrading trinkets really is worth it! Oh crap I just noticed baron is unwarded after I warded my tri-brush top lane... good thing I spent 250g on upgrading my trinket because now I can also ward baron :D Just an example. Seriously though everyone, I'm unranked  and I still upgrade my trinkets (in the games that I remember) But i'm getting better at it haha :) Save a life... either yours or the teammates.... also... DON'T TRY AND SAY YOU'RE THE ADC AND YOU DON'T HAVE TO WARD. If everyone would ward.. then we could make the rift a brighter place.. with... wait for it.... VISION <3

Your argument is with the inner-oxymoron.

The deeper psychological barrier to buying wards that you will never generally overcome is a shamefully noob belief that the player is safe as long as the scary enemy remains unseen in the dark. Warding threatens to reveal the scary awaiting ambush. It literally is a subconscious fear of imminent failure that prevents players from warding to avoid failure. Those who ward are the ones who have the will and fortitude to win, and are confident in their ability to deal with the enemy. That is why warding happens more often in higher tiers.
